verse: These are the words that the Lord spoke to Jeremiah ·about the time when there was no rain [concerning the drought; often a punishment from God; Lev. 26:18–20; Deut. 28:22–24; 1 Kin. 17:1]:
This is what the Lord says about this people [of Judah]:
Then the Lord said, “Don’t pray for good things to happen to the people [of Judah].

Even if they fast, I will not listen to their ·prayers [cry; Prov. 1:28]. Even if they offer burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] and ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [Lev. 2:1] to me, I will not ·accept [be pleased with] them. Instead, I will ·destroy [finish] them [the people of Judah] with ·war [sword], ·hunger [famine], and ·terrible diseases [plagues; pestilence].”

But I said, “Oh, Lord God, the prophets keep telling the people, ‘·You will not suffer from an enemy’s [Do not fear] sword or from ·hunger [famine]. I, the Lord, will give you ·lasting [reliable; true] peace in this land.’”

Then the Lord said to me, “Those prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I did not send them or ·appoint [command] them or speak to them. They have been prophesying false visions, idolatries, worthless ·magic [divination], and ·their own wishful thinking [the deceit of their hearts; Deut. 13:1–5; 18:14–22].

So this is what I say about the prophets who are prophesying in my name. I did not send them. They say, ‘·No enemy will attack this country with swords. There will never be hunger [Sword and famine will not be] in this land.’ So those prophets will ·die from [be finished off by] ·hunger [famine] and from ·an enemy’s sword [sword].

And the people to whom the prophets speak will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem. There they will die from ·hunger [famine] and from ·an enemy’s sword [sword]. And no one will be there to bury them, or their wives, or their sons, or their daughters. I will ·punish them [pour out on them harm/disaster/evil].
“Speak [addressed to Jeremiah] this ·message [word] to them [the people of Judah]:
